meanings.definition: The process of approving or certifying something as meeting certain standards or requirements.
meanings.sent1: The homologation of the new product ensured it met safety regulations.
meanings.sent2: The homologation of the document made it legally valid.
meanings.sent3: The homologation of the cake recipe by the chef brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: The homologation of her artwork by the art gallery elevated her status as an artist.
meanings.sent5: The homologation of the vaccine was a crucial step in its distribution.

meanings.definition: The act of making something official or legally binding.
meanings.sent1: His signature on the contract was the final step in the homologation of the agreement.
meanings.sent2: The homologation of the marriage certificate made their union official.
meanings.sent3: The homologation of the new rule brought a sense of order to the chaos.
meanings.sent4: The homologation of the decision by the board gave it authority.
meanings.sent5: The homologation of the contract ensured both parties were bound by its terms.

meanings.definition: The official recognition or acceptance of something.
meanings.sent1: The homologation of her achievement by the committee was a proud moment.
meanings.sent2: The homologation of the award validated her hard work.
meanings.sent3: The homologation of the pet as a therapy animal brought joy to the patients.
meanings.sent4: The homologation of the new policy by the team boosted morale.
meanings.sent5: The homologation of his talent by the judges was a turning point in his career.
